class  WatchAccessFromCallingThreadHolder
 A utility class for temporarily changing the file access watcher state for this thread, whilst automatically restoring the old state when the class instance goes out of scope. More...

Detailed Description

This class is intended to be used as a singleton.

It supports functionality for working with files in BigWorld's resource path.

It is also useful for operating multiple resource system contexts, where it may be desirable for extra resources to be visible to some threads but not others. In that case multiple instances of BWResource are permitted.

This class now contains all functionality previously owned by the now deprecated FilenameResolver, so use this class instead.

void BWResource::checkCaseOfPaths ( bool  enable  )  [static]

This enables/disables checking of filename case.

Parameters:
enable If true then the case of filenames are checked as used. This is useful to check for problems with files used on both Windows and Linux, but comes at a cost in execution speed.

Returns:

Returns false on error.

Returns the time the given file (or resource) was modified.

void BWResource::purge ( const std::string &  path,
bool  recursive = false,
DataSectionPtr  spSection = NULL 
)

Remove a resource from the cache.

Parameters:
path The path to the item to purge.
recursive Set this to true to perform a full recursive purge.
spSection If not NULL, this should be a pointer to the data section at 'path'. This is used to improve efficiency and avoid a problem with duplicate child names.

This method purges everything from the cache and census.

IFileSystem::FileType BWResource::resolveToAbsolutePath ( std::string &  path  )  [static]

Resolves the given path to an absolute path.

Loops through each filesystem and resolves the path to the first one that contains the file.

If the path is already an absolute path (i.e. it starts with a slash or drive letter), it simply returns the type of the file.

To resolve the path to a full path without checking for the existence of the file, see MultiFileSystem::getAbsolutePath().

Parameters:
Input,: The path to resolve. Output: The resolved path. Does not resolve the path if path does not exist in any file systems.
Returns:
The type of the file.

Returns the root section.
